themes: inclusivity and representation in arts programming
affordability and accessibility of cultural events
decentralization of arts events to neighborhoods
support for experimental and interdisciplinary arts
celebration of diverse cultural identities and histories
youth and marginalized group engagement in creative learning
key_phrases: inclusive, affordable, and representative of the city’s full cultural diversity
more neighborhood-based arts and music events
more space for experimental, interdisciplinary, or non-traditional arts
immersive theater, interactive installations, pole/dance art, and digital storytelling
low-cost or free workshops and creative learning spaces
foster a stronger pipeline of local creatives
barriers_identified: limited access to creative learning for youth and marginalized groups
solutions_proposed: increase neighborhood-based arts and music events
bring performances, pop-ups, and festivals into underrepresented neighborhoods
create more space for experimental, interdisciplinary, or non-traditional arts
offer events that honor and explore diverse cultural communities
provide low-cost or free workshops and creative learning spaces, especially for youth and marginalized groups
